_header: He that standeth sure enhaste him not to move
_description: Counsels of Prudence, an extract from Lydgate’s Troy Book (3995) — four couplets

BLRoy18Cii.Transcription:
He that stondeth suere enhast hym nat to meeveffor ȝif he doo
                    hit shall hym after greveAnd he that walketh suerly a pon the
                    playnffor to stumble it is but in vaynBut ȝif so be he liste of
                    his folyBe necligente to put hym selfe willefullyIn aventur & of
                    hym selfe nat reccheTo eschewe perell yholde hym but a wrecche
BLRoy18Cii.Editions:
Edwards,  A. S. G. 
             “An Unidentified Extract from Lydgate’s Troy Book” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 36 [234] (1989): 307-8: 308.
